Job Title: BenefitMall - Account Manager, Group Health Benefits (Remote)

Location: Los Angeles, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
The position is described below. If you want to apply, click the Apply button at the top or bottom of this page. You'll be required to create an account or sign in to an existing one.

Need Help?

If you have a disability and need assistance with the application, you can request a reasonable accommodation. Send an email to Accessibility (accommodation requests only; other inquiries won't receive a response).

Regular or Temporary:

Regular

Language Fluency: English (Required)

Work Shift:

1st shift (United States of America)

Please review the following job description:

As an Account Manager you will manage an employee benefits book of primarily small business clients. You will be focused on securing a client relationship where the client feels supported at all times by providing advice and recommendations in alignment with client requirements.

This is a fully remote position; however, to be considered candidates must be licensed and currently live in California.

The Account Service Division (ASD) at BenefitMall partners with brokers to manage existing books of business. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in small group benefits, preferably with a broker background. Skills required to be successful in this position are managing a high volume of business, strong multitasking and organizational skills, excellent communicator who collaborates well in a team environment, enjoys relationship-building, and the ability to adapt to change and adopt technology in a fast-growing organization. The compensation package includes monthly bonuses for performance and exceeds industry norms.

We are committed to providing a portfolio of competitive benefits for our growing organization and its diverse needs. We offer a wide range of health, welfare and financial benefits including medical, wellness, dental and vision, 401(K), flexible spending, health savings accounts, short and long term disability, life insurance and other unique employer sponsored and voluntary programs.

At BenefitMall, an industry leading provider of benefits services, we believe that it takes great employees to build a resilient organization. Our culture is based on corporate values that focus on inclusion, trust, collaboration, and innovation to help us build a bright future. As a result of listening to our employees, BenefitMall has earned a Top Workplaces USA award three years in a row (2021, 2022, & 2023) based solely on employee feedback and insight! If you want to work for a company where employees are valued and growth is encouraged, BenefitMall could be the place.

Required Responsibilities

Following is a summary of the essential functions for this job. Other duties may be performed, both major and minor, which are not mentioned below. Specific activities may change from time to time.

Work with Account Executive to manage renewals. Build and maintain client and carrier relationships. Act as the primary contact between clients, internal operations, and insurance carriers. Provide insurance expertise to clients and act as a knowledge resource for other members of the Account Management team. Help teammates resolve client issues. Educate, advise and aid clients on all Compliance topics such as, but not limited to, ERISA, POP, Cobra, FMLA. Review and deliver benefit booklets. Develop employee communications for renewal changes, enrollment procedures, miscellaneous benefit changes/clarifications. Serve as a source for information concerning market trends, pricing practices and other underwriting policies. Delegates work to support staff where applicable. Provides guidance to support staff where appropriate. Enroll clients in Employee Benefits communication tools. Demonstrate use of the tools with clients. Introduce. Conduct virtual and in person meetings to communicate or administer benefit plans. 

Required Qualifications

The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Associate degree or equivalent years of industry experience. Active life and health insurance license. 5+ years of experience in employee benefits in the small to mid-market space. Broker experience preferred. Excellent digital literacy, including working experience with Microsoft Office Suite and Salesforce. Be able to set priorities and manage deadlines. Able to work in a fast-paced, team environment with minimal instruction. Excellent written and oral communication skills. Ability to define problems and generate potential solutions. Keep informed about industry information, technology and trends. Establish good rapport with clients and teammates. 

The annual base salary for this position is $58,000 - $60,000.

General Description of Available Benefits for Eligible Employees of Truist Financial Corporation: All regular teammates (not temporary or contingent workers) working 20 hours or more per week are eligible for benefits, though eligibility for specific benefits may be determined by the division of Truist offering the position. Truist offers medical, dental, vision, life insurance, disability, accidental death and dismemberment, tax-preferred savings accounts, and a 401k plan to teammates. Teammates also receive no less than 10 days of vacation (prorated based on date of hire and by full-time or part-time status) during their first year of employment, along with 10 sick days (also prorated), and paid holidays. For more details on Truist’s generous benefit plans, please visit our Benefits site. Depending on the position and division, this job may also be eligible for Truist’s defined benefit pension plan, restricted stock units, and/or a deferred compensation plan. As you advance through the hiring process, you will also learn more about the specific benefits available for any non-temporary position for which you apply, based on full-time or part-time status, position, and division of work.

CRC supports a diverse workforce and is an Equal Opportunity Employer that does not discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, gender, color, religion, citizenship or national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status or other classification protected by law. CRC is a Drug Free Workplace.

EEO is the Law Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision E-Verify

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
